intro: Salsola kali var. apula, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in disturbed soils and saline conditions. The plant features succulent, spiny stems and leaves that are often covered in a whitish, powdery coating called bloom, which helps reduce water loss. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense, spherical heads, and it produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Salsola kali var. apula is considered an invasive species in many regions, outcompeting native vegetation and altering local ecosystems.
